cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then curving north toward the Florida Panhandle / Alabama coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the FL Panhandle–south-central Alabama coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Mississippi eastward through the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph; tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (≤3% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the west-central Florida coast near Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Sunday into Monday could total 3–5 inches, locally higher, causing brief flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in rain bands through Sunday.
